review_title: Good remuneration package, bad work culture
pros: GPE offers an attractive salary package.
cons: Staff diversity is a huge challenge in the organization. Leadership doesn't have clarity of vision and strategic direction and struggles to take decisive action. The phase ' building a plane while flying it' is considered a bragging right rather than a concern in terms of its constantly shifting operational priorities. Very little opportunity for career growth, especially if you are not from Europe or North America. Difficult to move onto other organizations as it has a reputation for toxic environment and is considered by many as 'a graveyard for talents'.

review_title: Great Org, but limited long-term career opps
pros: Interesting international development work, all colleagues committed to GPE's mission, a mild agile (mid-size) startup feel due to still evolving organizational structure and regular internal evaluations, makes strong effort to be inclusive of everyone's opinions and ideas and to have open internal communication, good work-life-balance
cons: Low likelihood of ever receiving full-time status due to limited  FT hiring horizon in combination with the annual 150-day limit when under contract as an STC severely limits the annual salary one can earn and hence sadly makes employment unsustainable; no real formal onboarding for STCs

pros: people are kind and friendly, so nice to work with
cons: type of the job is not based on projects but grants, which makes it hard to evaluate the success of the organization
